resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/103274</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>103274</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770212897</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Twister: the Tornado Story</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Twister: die Tornado-Geschichte</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Twister : l'histoire de tornade</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Twister: a história do furacão</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Twister: la storia di ciclone</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Twister: η ιστορία ανεμοστροβίλου</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Twister: la historia del tornado</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Tornadoes are capable of serious destruction. What gets them twisting? Where do they get their energy? How can we protect ourselves when a tornado is approaching?</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Science and Technology</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Tornados sind zur ernsten Zerstörung fähig. 
Was erhält sie verdrehend? Woher erhalten sie ihre 
Energie? Wie können wir uns schützen, wenn ein Tornado sich 
nähert?</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les tornades sont capables de la destruction 
sérieuse. Que les obtient tordant ? D'où obtiennent-ils 
leur énergie ? Comment pouvons-nous nous protéger quand une 
tornade s'approche ?</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Os furacões são capazes da destruição séria. 
Que os começa que torcem? De onde começam sua energia? 
Como podemos nós se proteger quando um furacão se está 
aproximando?</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">I cicloni sono capaci di distruzione seria. 
Che cosa li ottiene che torcono? Dove ottengono la loro 
energia? Come possiamo proteggersi quando un ciclone sta 
avvicinandosi a?</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Οι ανεμοστρόβιλοι είναι ικανοί της σοβαρής 
καταστροφής. Αυτό που τους παίρνει στρίβοντας; Πού 
παίρνουν την ενέργειά τους; Πώς μπορούμε να προστατευθούμε
όταν πλησιάζει ένας ανεμοστρόβιλος;</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Los tornados son capaces de la destrucción seria.
¿Qué los consigue que tuercen? ¿De dónde consiguen su 
energía? ¿Cómo podemos protegernos cuando un tornado se está 
acercando?</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Wissenschaft und Technologie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">La Science et technologie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciência e tecnologia</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienza e tecnologia</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Επιστήμη και τεχνολογία</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencia y tecnología</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <lifeCycle>
          <contribute>
            <role>
              <source>roleValues</source>
              <value>author</value>
            </role>
            <entity>BEGIN:VCARD
N:DAVID TENENBAUM
FN:DAVID TENENBAUM
VERSION:3.0
END:VCARD</entity>
          </contribute>
        </lifeCycle>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770212897</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Custom License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>103274</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/twister-the-tornado-story</uri>

    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
